item.title: 17 reasons why are doctors reluctant to accept vitamin D
item.description:
1. Myth: Excess vitamin D will turn the human body into marble

Until recently medical students were told that > 2,000 IU of vitamin D could cause toxicity and Calcifications

It is difficult to unlearn something.

See Myth for 50 years: 2000 IU of vitamin D is toxic - still taught as fact in 2010

item.title: Turkey gave 400 IU vitamin D to all infants and reduced Rickets by 60X - 2011
item.description:
Free vitamin D supplementation for every infant in Turkey

Arch Dis Child. 2007 April; 92(4): 373–374.; doi: 10.1136/adc.2006.113829.

PMCID: PMC2083692

Sükrü Hatun, Abdullah Bereket, Behzat Özkan, Turgay Çoþkun, Rýfat Köse, and Ali Süha Çalýkoðlu

Correspondence to: S Hatun sukruhatun@gmail.com

We read with interest the article by Zipitis et al 1 concerning primary care trusts providing funds for vitamin D supplementation of Asian children for at least the first 2?years of life.

Nutritional rickets remains prevalent in developing regions of the world such as Africa, the Indian subcontinent, Asia and the Middle East, and ranks among the five most common diseases in children.2,3,4 The prevalence of nutritional rickets in developed countries also seems to be rising.5,6,7,8,9,10,11

item.title: Vitamin D Recommendations around the world - IU and ng
item.description:
Recommendations around the world during the past 50 years have varied a lot. Almost all have gone up, but a few have gone down

  2. How much vitamin D in blood serum: nanograms/ml
